meanings.definition: To surpass in building or construction.
meanings.sent1: The new skyscraper outbuilt all the other buildings in the city.
meanings.sent2: The team of skilled architects outbuilt their competitors in the design competition.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant outbuilt the other insects by constructing a complex underground tunnel system.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed outbuilt any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The beehive, meticulously crafted by the bees, outbuilt any human-made structure in its intricacy.

meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization outbuilt their predecessors in architectural marvels.
meanings.sent2: After years of hard work, they finally outbuilt their own expectations.
meanings.sent3: The children's sandcastle outbuilt all the others on the beach, much to their delight.
meanings.sent4: The towering castle ruins outbuilt the surrounding landscape, a testament to its former glory.
meanings.sent5: The massive dam, once completed, outbuilt any previous engineering feats in the region.
